page.title: 04Electricty Research Centre
page.content: The Electricity Council's Research Centre was established in 1965 to develop electrotechnology by research into new methods of electricity distribution and utilisation. Three quarters of the research is associated with the use of electricity especially in industry the rest with distribution by reducing equipment and operating costs & improving reliability & fault detection. New processes, developed here are offered to industry via licensing agreements & currently there are over 40 of these ranging from electrochemical products & processes, effluent treatment & materials recycling, through industrial heating, drying & processing (including the continuous heating of foodstuffs by ohmic heating) to metals technology & Environmental Engineering (eg.energy efficient house designs)
